item.title: Dangerous ice on the road had caused 2 accidents tonight, 4th January
item.description:
Our road is extremely icy and has not been gritted, as a result there has been 2 crashes tonight, in both cases the drivers didn't stop. At 00:55 the first car (white) came round the corner, skidded and crashed into a parked car. They're was substantial damage to the parked car and to the one that drove off, you could hear it scrapping the road as it went passed. Then at 01:28 it happened again with a dark coloured car skidding round the corner and hitting a parked car. The part of Dunbar Avenue from 40 to 66 doesn't fully thaw as it never gets the sun so the ice just keeps re freezing. We need this to be sorted before more cars are damaged.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dunbar Avenue, Elmers End, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: White substance on the road, 4th January
item.description:
There is some sort of white substance on the road not sure what it is but looks like white paint pls can council contractors come out and clean it thank you

item.title: Big water spillage in the road, blocking the size of the pot hole. big enough, 4th January
item.description:
Driving towards king college hospital. In the road there is a water spillage and a big pot hole. The pot hole is very bad it bursted my tyre and my car will need to be further inspected. I want to claim for this issue has I have now incurred a cost
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 149-153, Denmark Hill, Camberwell, Greater London

item.title: Household waste everywhere, 4th January
item.description:
I am reporting a significant amount of fly-tipping and littering on the public highway and verge opposite 2 Briset Road, SE9 6JY. The attached photographs show: • Large quantities of discarded beer cans and glass bottles • Cardboard boxes and packaging dumped within bushes and along the verge • General household rubbish scattered across the pavement edge, kerbside, and within surrounding vegetation • Waste partially hidden in shrubs and wooded areas, suggesting deliberate dumping rather than accidental littering The waste is spread over a wide area, including the footpath, kerb line, and inside the bushes adjacent to the street. Some items appear broken (including glass), posing a risk to pedestrians, cyclists, and wildlife. This appears to be a recurring and ongoing problem, not a one-off incident, as the quantity and spread of waste suggest repeated dumping over time. I believe this location is on public land / highway, and I am requesting clearance of the dumped waste and investigation due to the persistent nature of the issue. Photographs are attached for reference.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Briset Road, Eltham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Bin has not been collected - littering the street, 3rd January
item.description:
The blue bin outside 29 Dagmar road has not been collected for weeks. It is full up to the brim. The bin has no lid and the wind/foxes are spreading the litter across the street. Please could this be collected as is making the area look unsightly.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 28, Dagmar Road, Camberwell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Repeated dog fouling, 3rd January
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Woodlands Road, Welling, Greater London
